snippet: The prosecutor general’s office outlawed the National Democratic Institute, saying it posed “a threat to the foundations of Russia’s constitutional order and national security.”
abstract: Office of Russia's prosecutor general bans nonprofit group National Democratic Institute, claiming it poses threat to country's order and security; group joins list of five American-linked organizations that fall under restrictions signed into law by Pres Vladimir Putin; activists denounce law as another measure to stifle civil rights.
lead_paragraph: The prosecutor general’s office outlawed the National Democratic Institute, saying it posed “a threat to the foundations of Russia’s constitutional order and national security.”

headline.main: Pro-Democracy Nonprofit Is Banned in Russia
headline.print_headline: Russia Bans Group Active in Pushing Democracy

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
